intro: Orthandra cirrhosa, commonly known as the silky orthandra, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant is characterized by its slender, arching stems and clusters of small, bell-shaped white flowers. Its leaves are narrow and covered in a fine, silky hair, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and swamps.
